byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, April 4.-There was a general decline of European and South American purchases of United States goods in February, according to statistics on this country's foreign trade for the month and made public today by the Department of Commerce.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 4.-There was a general decline of European and South American purchases of United States goods in February, according to statistics on this country's foreign trade for the month and made public today by the Department of Commerce.

headline.main: FEBRUARY EXPORTS LOWER THAN IN 1938; Our Imports, Too, From Europe and South America Receded From Year BeforeAIRCRAFT BUSINESS GAINSFighting-Plane Shipments toBritain and France Increased31% in the 12 Months

docs.snippet: South American nations bear a special relation to the United States and our trade policies should be clarified and modified accordingly, declared Colonel Frank Knox, Chicago newspaper publisher and Republican nominee for Vice President in 1936, on...
docs.lead_paragraph: South American nations bear a special relation to the United States and our trade policies should be clarified and modified accordingly, declared Colonel Frank Knox, Chicago newspaper publisher and Republican nominee for Vice President in 1936, on his arrival in New York yesterday.

headline.main: FREE TRADE URGED TO SOUTH AMERICA; Col. Knox Returns, Advising U.S. to Change Its Policy of Equal Treatment ESPECIALLY WITH BRAZIL Contends 'Laxness' in Mexican Situation Has Brought on Us 'a Certain Contempt'
